Posts.Content: On Mar 11, 2009 12:00 AM sarahruth66 wrote: I was on tamoxafin for 5 years.  I had very few side effects.  I was changed to femara.  I stayed on it for 3 years, and never knew the horrible pain and arthritis in joints was a side effect.  I have been off it for 9 months and still can't stand up straight and walk.  I have constant joint and muscle pain.  Does anyone know if this goes away?  Is there any thing that can be done for relief from these terrible side effects?  I am on Femara too and have had terrible side effects.  I have osteoarthritis and it has made all joints hurt more than ever.  I had 2 hip replacements and the left hip is hurting now.  Shoulders, feet, knees, wrists, etc.  It makes me feel like I have the flu all day long and dizzy spells at least once a week. I cannot believe that this drug could be good for those who have osteoarthritis and I also have lichens sclerosis which has flared 3 times in 6 months.  Had not had flares for over a year prior to Femara.  Is it worth it?  I am thinking it isn't. Long term effects are not known on any of the aromatase inhibitors so another drug company money maker but not knowing what happens after your 5-10 year dosage.
Posts.Title: femara long term effects
